      program combined
      implicit none
      integer(4) :: D, i, j, k, bitmask, solve_num, INF1
      integer(8) :: G, score, min1, min2, cnt, bills, tmp
      integer(4), allocatable :: p(:), c(:)
      character(len=100) :: input_line   ! for reading, but we don't use
      character(len=:), allocatable :: s1, s2, s3
      integer(4) :: len1, len2, len3, i4
      integer(4), allocatable :: digits(:)
      character :: ch

      ! Read the first program input
      read(*,*) D, G
      allocate(p(D), c(D)) do i = 1, D
          read(*,*) p(i), c(i)
      end do

      ! First program logic
      INF1 = 100000
      min1 = INF1   ! min1 is integer(8)

      do bitmask = 0, (2**D - 1)
          score = 0
          solve_num = 0
          do i = 0, D-1
              if (btest(bitmask, i)) then   ! i-th bit is set (i from 0 to D-1)
                  ! problem index i+1
                  score = score + 100_8 * (i+1) * p(i+1) + c(i+1) solve_num = solve_num + p(i+1)
              end if
          end do

          if (score < G) then
              ! We try to add problems from the hardest (largest i) to easiest
              outer: do i = D-1, 0, -1
                  if (.not. btest(bitmask, i)) then
                      ! We can solve up to p(i+1)-1 problems of category i+1
                      do j = 1, p(i+1)-1
                          score = score + 100_8 * (i+1) solve_num = solve_num + 1
                          if (score >= G) then
                              exit outer
                          end if
                      end do
                  end if
              end do outer
          end if

          if (score >= G) then
              if (solve_num < min1) then
                  min1 = solve_num
              end if
          end if
      end do

      ! Now convert min1 to string s1
      allocate(character(len=20) :: s1)
      write(s1, '(I0)') min1
      s1 = adjustl(s1)   ! left adjust
      len1 = len_trim(s1)

      ! Second program: 
      allocate(digits(1:len1+2))
      digits = 0

      do i = 1, len1
          digits(i) = ichar(s1(len1-i+1:len1-i+1)) - ichar('0')
      end do

      bills = 0
      do i = 1, len1+1
          if (digits(i) == 10) then
              digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
              digits(i) = 0
          end if

          if (digits(i) < 5) then
              bills = bills + digits(i)
          else if (digits(i) == 5) then
              if (digits(i+1) >= 5) then
                  digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
              end if
              bills = bills + 5
          else
              bills = bills + (10 - digits(i))
              digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
          end if
      end do
      min2 = bills

      ! Convert min2 to string s2
      allocate(character(len=20) :: s2)
      write(s2, '(I0)') min2
      s2 = adjustl(s2) len2 = len_trim(s2)

      ! Third program: replace "BC" with "D"
      s3 = ''
      i = 1
      do while (i <= len2) if (i < len2) then
              if (s2(i:i) == 'B' .and. s2(i+1:i+1) == 'C') then
                  s3 = s3 // 'D'
                  i = i + 2
                  cycle
              end if
          end if
          s3 = s3 // s2(i:i)
          i = i + 1
      end do
      len3 = len_trim(s3)

      ! Now traverse s3 for the counting
      cnt = 0
      tmp = 0
      do i = 1, len3
          ch = s3(i:i) if (ch == 'A') then
              tmp = tmp + 1
          else if (ch == 'D') then
              cnt = cnt + tmp
          else
              tmp = 0
          end if
      end do

      ! Output the result
      write(*,'(I0)') cnt

      end program combined
